sentences: Mohammad Sabir Baburaj was an Indian music composer.
section: N/A

sentences: He is often credited for the renaissance of Malayalam film music.
section: N/A

sentences: Baburaj has rendered music to many evergreen Malayalam film songs.
section: N/A
== Early years ==
== Early years ==

sentences: Baburaj was born on 9 March 1929 in Kozhikode, then known as Calicut.
section: == Early years ==

sentences: His early childhood was spent in destitution and poverty.
section: == Early years ==

sentences: His father, Jan Muhammed Khan, who was a Hindustani musician from Bengal who frequently held concerts in Kerala, deserted his Malayali mother when he was very young, and returned to his native Kolkata.
section: == Early years ==

sentences: Baburaj thus became fatherless, often singing songs in trains to make a living.
section: == Early years ==

sentences: But as luck would have it, a policeman, Kunjumuhammed (he was called Kunjumuhammed ika), an enthusiast of music from his native town of Kozhikode, noticing the boy's vocal talents, decided to virtually adopt him.
section: == Early years ==
== Music career ==
== Music career ==

sentences: One of his greatest achievements was the introduction of Hindustani strains into Malayalam popular music.
section: == Music career ==

sentences: He successfully composed melodies based on Hindustani Ragas and blended Malayalam lyrics into them.
section: == Music career ==

sentences: Most of the lyrics were written by eminent Malayalam poets like P. Bhaskaran and Vayalar.
section: == Music career ==

sentences: Baburaj learned basic lessons of Hindustani music from his father from a very young age, but he could not learn it for long due to his father's demise.
section: == Music career ==

sentences: In search of pure music, young Baburaj visited West Bengal, Mumbai and Sri Lanka.
section: == Music career ==

sentences: He learned to play the Harmonium during this period.
section: == Music career ==

sentences: He came back to Kerala to a precarious existence.
section: == Music career ==

sentences: He sang on the streets of Kozhikode to earn his livelihood.
section: == Music career ==

sentences: Police constable Kunju Muhammed, who was a fan of Baburaj's father, adopted him and brought him up.
section: == Music career ==

sentences: Later he started composing music for the Malayalam dramas in the Malabar region and thus slowly entered the field of music direction.
section: == Music career ==

sentences: In 1957, he composed music for the Malayalam film Minnaminungu, by Ramu Kariat, thus entering the Malayalam film industry.
section: == Music career ==

sentences: Then he worked with director P. Venu and composed classic songs like "Anuragaganam Pole", "Ezhuthiyatharanu Sujatha", and "Kalichirimaaratha Penne" for the film Udhyogastha (1967).
section: == Music career ==

sentences: Baburaj was also an accomplished singer and harmonium player.
section: == Music career ==

sentences: Baburaj died an early death, on 7 October 1978 at the age of 49.
section: == Music career ==

sentences: His death occurred in a general hospital in Madras, after suffering from a massive hemorrhagic stroke.
section: == Music career ==

sentences: He was survived by his wife and children.
section: == Music career ==
== Music career ==

sentences: The Baburaj – P. Bhaskaran – Yesudas combination produced many of the most memorable Malayalam tunes of the 1960s and 1970s.
section: == Music career ==

sentences: Most of his classic duets were sung by P Leela, K. J. Yesudas and S. Janaki, each recording solo Baburaj compositions as well.
section: == Music career ==

sentences: Many of Baburaj's songs remain very popular in Kerala, with songs like "Oru Pushpam Maatram" frequently rendered on stage at various events.
section: == Music career ==

sentences: The Manorama Music company chanced upon an old audio cassette of Baburaj rendering some of his own compositions in a platform of friends' circle.
section: == Music career ==

sentences: The cassette named 'Baburaj Padunnu' was re-mixed and became an instant hit.
section: == Music career ==

sentences: The tracks gave Kerala a rejuvenated taste of Baburaj's music with his unique style of soulful singing.
section: == Music career ==

sentences: Though a successful composer, Baburaj was never a careerist, but kept his focus on his art.
section: == Music career ==

sentences: Today, various clubs and musical organisations conduct stage programs in honour of Baburaj ('Babukka' to his friends and acquaintances), and give the proceeds to his family.
section: == Music career ==

sentences: During his time, money was not easy to come by for artists, and Baburaj never managed to earn much, dying in poverty.
section: == Music career ==

sentences: "Thrikkakkare theerthakkare" in the 1978 film Yagaswam, directed by Hariharan, was his last recorded song.
